Summary: We have been camping here for a couple of years every august after being done with River camping. It is closer to our home and we do not have to drive for hours like we would when camping in Kern River. Has hot showers, close places to shop for anything you forget and once we didn't take any food and just got everything at the supermarket there. Some sites are small and hard to find. When I have been lucky I found two sites together for bigger space and not too close to others.

I have NEVER been to an rv park where the quiet hours are from 8pm to 10am. 14 HOURS? Snobby people! LOVE Dana Point but I will not be staying at this park! I was here several years ago and I'm sure those rules still apply.

Doheny has so much going for it, gorgeous views, beachfront camping(if you are lucky to get a site), lots to do at Dana Point Harbor, with many great restaurants with amazing food. There is a downside to this place, though. It ‘s VERY crowded and noisy with kids screaming and some late night parties. There has been a lot of theft of bikes and generators even chained up, so beware. Also a large homeless population nearby as well. Extremely hard to get reservations here but worth it.

Summary Heading: Too many dogs unleashed  on the beach
Summary: We camp beachfront  several times throughout the year.  We have noticed more dogs unleashed on the beach now and dog owners are not picking up after their pets letting them do their business on the sand.  No dogs allowed on the beach is clearly posted but not enforced.   We are looking for a cleaner beach for kids and camping

My daughter and I are still shaken by our experience.  I followed all guidelines (unlike anyone else in the park who don't wear masks OR social distance).  Brought my proof of reservation (from Reserve California) asked questions, even stopped by a week ahead to make sure everything would go smoothly.  That didn't stop the park ranger and camp host from calling State Police to harass me, as I returned from lunch, as if they were about to ambush me in front of the entire campground. This was the THIRD CONFRONTATION--what more did they want from me??  I was outraged and let them know it.  Why is a STATE POLICE getting involved in a civil matter over a single night campspot??  Why other than RACE (Im Mexican American) did they perceive a short middle age woman and her daughter of a

Summary Heading: On the water but not a shining example.
Summary: Not a good beach for the rocks and sharp bottom associated with it. The campground is fair but old and the campsites are expensive, crowded and hard to get a reservation to in the season. Try Carlsbad or any of the beach parks north for better quality.

Old campground. Beachside camping is on the sand. The rest of the sights are right on top of each other. We had beachside and enjoyed our stay. The restrooms and showers need updating. Some people run their generators outside of the allowed hours.

This place get busy during the summer months and we finally got reservations in the fall. Doheny is a ‘Dry’ campground. They have a few water spigots, two restrooms with token operated showers, each site had picnic tables and fire pits. The attraction is camping next to the beach for surfing, swimming, fishing, sand play for kids and allowed to have your dog while on a leash. We did not plan on cooking, so having restaurants and fast foods nearby was great. Only thing I didn’t like was the sites were not angled and the road was narrow. The waste dump is outside of the campground.

Summary Heading: Love to walk this State Park
Summary: Lots of parking, lots of beach and great family fun!  I walk the park abt 3 times a week & am always impressed with the beauty!  You can see the point of Dana Point, from the beach.  They have overnight camping & day camping.  Great family fun!

Very nice hotel and well maintained.  Rooms were very clean, and the staff was very courteous and helpful.  Our room was on the 16th floor with an exceptional view of the mountains.  The rooms were very quite.  This hotel also has numerous restaurants, and a large Casino.  The parking lot was outdoors so one can park a high profile van or motor home without any difficulties.  Great access to Hwy 580 and 80.

We enjoyed camping here. We had an RV but there are no hookups at this beach. The showers are clean. Besides are well-maintained and separated by some bushes. There are quite a few right on the oceanfront. There is a nice bike trail going both directions up and down the coast

My wife and I really enjoyed our time in spot 49.   Mid week only 1/3 full. A bit chilly but we really appreciated the view bike rides and close proximity to restaurants within walk or bike distance. This is dry camping and they are strict in generator time.  Out at 8pm. We camped in a motorhome.   Site has picnic table and fire pit on beach.   You face south so sunset is to left and sunrise from the right.    So hard to get these sites during summer months

Summary Heading: 30 year Doheny camper with a Beef
Summary: On our latest visit in August 2017 we were overrun with squirrels on campsite 54. Theywere everywhere. They climbed into the undercarriage of vehicles and even tried to get into our trailer.They were completely unafraid of anything. It did not appear that the staff has a plan to control them. I do not have a solution but maybe a call to OC vector  control is in order. We will be back to Doheny in Sept. and Nov 2017 and hope there is an effort to control the rodents because I fear that one of the kids will be bitten or become ill if they come into contact with the rodent droppings. Other than the above our entire family loves everything about DohenySB The trains The bike rides the sunsets the walks on the beach.The grandkids love the junior Ranger program.

Even though there are no hookups and the spots are pretty close together, you just can't beat the view of the ocean.    There are also rentals available, food and ice cream.  Great place for kids to enjoy the beach.   Fire pits are right on the sand.

Summary Heading: TENTERS: Noise and baths offset family-friendliness
Summary: Let's start with the good: we arrived to a clean, small campsite with a clean fire pit and picnic table perched on the edge of the sand.  I did note that the campsites were smooshed together, but the location is wonderful.  You climb a tiny sand dune and are looking down at a lovely, pebble-strewn beach that has low, gentle waves that is perfect for families.  This was our 3 1/2 year old son's first night tent camping and we roasted hot dogs and s'mores over our fire with a picturesque sunset.  Can't get any better than that...  Except for the noise after the supposed 10pm shut-down: we had the privilege of listening into not one...but two families, on each side of us, shriek, laugh and shout into the wee hours of the morning.  Yes, we heard their personal conversations, and

What can I say, any time at the beach is wonderful. The train that runs directly through the campsites surprisingly is extremely quiet ,the roar of the ocean was sometimes louder ...in fact they had to build a sand berm because the ocean was so loud and strong at the time we visited.... the showers were extremely hot and with amazingly hard pressure( did cost you a token for 2 minutes) token were available at the dispense machine located right outside the facilities... campground hosts we're extremely on top of all activities, curtious and helpful!! You have a local wharf to ride or walk to if you would like to eat seaside fresh fish or watch the fisherman come In at night with their cartch... I enjoyed my visit and I think anyone who enjoys the beach weather, good respectful

Summary Heading: Beach camping with plenty to do
Summary: Have been coming here for some time now. We were in an RV at one of the beachfront spots. This is probably the best way to to camp here since the other campsites are interior and most are on top of one another. All sites are primitive. The restroom and shower facilities newer and very clean during our visit.  There is plenty to do here from hanging out at the beach, bicycling to the nearby Dana Point Harbor, or take a longer ride on the San Juan Creek bike path up to San Juan Capistrano.  A great place to go. We love it.

I personally love Doheny for its close proximity to home, but I recommend only a site that is in the oceanfront row because the other sites are too close together.  There are lots of rocks in the water.  The campground is at ocean level so you can clearly hear the waves at night.  It also sounds like the train is going through your tent at times but that's because the tracks are 75 feet from the campground.

The entire facility is in desperate need of a major renovation. Yes it's beachfront but extremely run down. Bathrooms are hit and miss, sometimes clean, sometimes disgustingly filthy. It feels like the train is running through your campsite at night.  The beach is right off a major drainage route San Juan Creek. That drains directly into the ocean when it rains and tons of contaminants are washed into the ocean. Totally disgusting.   I booked a space and my reservation said 2 vehicles. I parked my RV and rented a car locally. They charged $15 per day because the car "was not towed in" even though I am entitled to 2 cars. But that's just the state of California shaking down every last penny with fine print. NEVER COMING BACK.

Great beach with awesome beach front camping spots and plenty of beach and local activities. We camped the 1st week of August for an extended weekend. Everything was nice, plenty of kids and families cruising the camp ground. The waves are small but good location to paddle board, surf or kyak. The day area has plenty of room for day use party's or just about what ever you want to do. They have plenty of Volly ball courts, bike rentals and grass areas, the Dana point harbor is within walking distance with plenty of rentals and daily fishing trips. There are also fine dinning restaurants across the harbor that are still within walking distance. The camping area is dry camp only but has a dump station and fresh water to fill up with nice restrooms and showers. The only bad thing I

Summary Heading: Pros and Cons for Camping Light
Summary: We live near here and always refer to this as Camping Light. Even though you may have a trailer or a tent-the fact you can see fast food places and AM/PM kind of takes away from the whole camp experience. Then again...its a blessing when you run out of food, drinks, ice etc etc. When you can get a site on the beach is the best. As others mentioned...not uncommon to have the homeless strolling through at times but have never had an issue. Once again....great if you can land the beachside site, maybe not so much for other sites.  Also note, can be a lot of fun for Fisherman to go out on one of the boats in Dana Point Harbour fishing, and come back to the campsite to cook the fish and relax.

My family and I camp here every year.  There are token showers and restroom facilities but they are not always the cleanest.  Some lots are shaded, and some not.  Some lots are next to the street and some lots are next to the sand!!  We normally take whatever we can get with this campground because it is in such high demand and we cannot afford to be choosy.  The location is unbelievable, and to us that makes up for all the rest.  We get to sleep to the sound of the waves.  The beach is right by the campground without having to cross any street.  The location can't be beat.

Desided to stop here on the coastal drive and let the kids get wet , this park is very nice and clean and you have pleanty of parking. The beach is just a skip and a jump away from the parking lot. Thete is actually surfing going on and i read you can actually whale watch if your lucky enough.

The campground is clean. Some of the spots are too tight for tent trailers and a big truck. Definitely will go again but only if we get beach front our a bigger space.  If you decide to go here just know there are no hook ups for trailers and quiet time is 8 pm-10 am. So no loud generators would work.makr sure you bring a perkalator for coffee. Lol

Summary Heading: We stayed right on the Sand!
Summary: Really enjoyed our Camping stay. We stayed on a beach front site (40) May 17-20 2016. Tues-Fri. It was such a nice spot. We had a trailer so did not use any facilities. It had some older shrubs between a lot of the sites, which gave some privacy. We were right on the sand, steps from the water with our own fire pit and picnic table. We loved the sound of the waves all night long. The beach front sites go fast, there are others but not so nice, a little crowded and some very close the train and traffic noise. The beach is not that good for swimming, a little pebbly sand and a bit of a rip. Children under 12 or so would need to be supervised closely. Our 4 grand kids still had a great time though (2,4,5,8) The little ones loved the sand and running from the waves. The 8 year old

Very clean well maintained campground. Our 3rd time camping here. Need to make reservations well in advance for weekends weekdays not as hard to get reservations in off season. Not a good swimming beach due to rip currents.

This is a great beach campground. All sites are very close to beach, many are on the beach. No hookups; however, there is a water filling station and dump just past the entrance. Same issues you would find at any California State Beach campground (train noise, generator and bike thefts, homeless). These issues are at most beach campgrounds along the coast, just be prepared and aware so you don't ruin your trip. This campground is great for bike riding and is very close to the harbor. We rode our bikes to the harbor and went on a sunset wine cruise one day and whale watching the next. Plenty of great restaurants nearby if you don't want to cook. There is also a Ralph's and Costco close by if you need groceries. We crossed the street to the hotel (forgot the name) and went to the

Summary Heading: Must not love the beach as much as I thought.....
Summary: Got a space across from the restrooms which was good and bad. Lots of homeless that come in around midnight and linger in the restroom. One night some one set a fire in one restroom. Found out a shower cost $1 for 2 - 2 minute tokens. The noise was incredible throught the nite. First, the train (wow), next the homeless that walk around and talk to each other, then when it is finally quiet, I heard people yelling at each other in the distance and what also sounded like a gun. We were lucky it was not raining or we would have had a spot in a lake. I did like flying a kite on the beach. The stores did not open early and when they were supposed to be open they weren't. Sounds like no one cared to do business.

if you are looking for a campground for a family with kids of all ages I would definitely recommend Doheny. Doheny sits right at the base of Dana Point and sits right on the sand. Although the sites on the actual beach are highly coveted if you get stuck in any other site you are only a stone's throw away from the sand and water. The park is maintained just ok. It gets a lot of use and the best quote is " rode hard put away wet (or dry wit our recent wate restrictions). The aesthetics have something to be desired but when you're on the beach so who cares. The only other issue with the park that we had in our two night stay was the first night some freedom campers set up camp at 3:30 in the morning and started pounding their tent stakes into their free campsite which was highly

Summary Heading: Can't get any closer to the beach - and the railroad track
Summary: You gotta love CA's state beaches. They are conveniently located and (mostly) clean. Dana Point's Doheny State Beach makes no exception. It's smack in a triangle of highway, shoreline and railroad tracks. The latter makes for noisy nights the closer you are to the rear of the park. Shoreline spots fill up quickly - and for good reason: This is prime beach camping!   Fires are allowed and there are fire rings. Magnificient sunsets at the campfire are guaranteed. Throw in some dolphin, seals and whales in season and you have an unforgettable camping experience.   What amazed us most was the cleanliness of the place. That said, of course the restrooms are not spic and span anymore in the late evening, but there's a cleaning crew everyday that does a great job.  The beach at the
